summary: The U.S. Army manages over $200 billion in equipment and parts. With a new online system, it anticipates better logistics management—tracking supplies, maintaining property accountability, and monitoring maintenance—and saving $12 billion through 2027. But the Army noted that the system is difficult to use and doesn't work in all combat situations (like remote locations without network access). title: Defense Logistics: Army Should Ensure New System Operates in All Situations and Soldiers Complete Training
